intro: Gynochthodes hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan gynochthodes, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, round fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
